title: Amboli Hill Station
subtitle: The Queen of the Sahyadri Hills
overview: Amboli, known as the ‘Queen of the Sahyadri Hills’, is a picturesque hill station located in the Sindhudurg district of Maharashtra.
It is the last hill station before the coastal plains of Goa begin and lies at an altitude of about 690 meters above sea level.
Famous for its misty mountains, cascading waterfalls, dense forests, and cool climate, Amboli is an ideal destination for nature lovers, photographers, and trekkers.

highlights.title: Majestic Waterfalls
highlights.description: Amboli is adorned with stunning waterfalls that come alive during the monsoon, creating a breathtaking view.

highlights.title: Biodiversity Hotspot
highlights.description: The forests of Amboli are home to rare species of flora and fauna, making it a paradise for nature enthusiasts.

highlights.title: Scenic Photography
highlights.description: The misty valleys, winding roads, and lush greenery make Amboli perfect for photography and videography.

geography.intro: Located in the southern range of the Sahyadris, Amboli lies at an altitude of 690 meters, receiving the highest rainfall in Maharashtra.

climate.description: Amboli experiences a cool and humid climate throughout the year, with heavy rainfall during the monsoon season.

seasons.text: Monsoon: 15°C – 25°C, heavy rainfall from June to September

geography.conclusion: The consistent coolness and abundant greenery make Amboli a soothing escape from urban life.

activities.title: Waterfall Trekking
activities.description: Explore the lush forest trails leading to Amboli Waterfall and Nangartas Waterfall.
info: Wear non-slip footwear during monsoon treks.
Best for adventure and photography enthusiasts.

activities.title: Bird Watching
activities.description: Amboli is a hotspot for bird lovers, especially during winter migration.
info: Spot Malabar Trogon, Paradise Flycatcher, and Great Hornbill.
Early morning is the best time for sightings.

activities.title: Nature Trails
activities.description: Walk through dense forests and enjoy the serenity of nature.
info: Ideal for morning or evening strolls.
Listen to the soothing sounds of chirping birds and waterfalls.

attractions.title: Amboli Waterfall
attractions.description: A popular spot cascading down rocky terrain, especially vibrant during monsoon.

attractions.title: Hiranyakeshi Temple
attractions.description: A sacred temple where the Hiranyakeshi River originates from a cave, dedicated to Goddess Parvati.

attractions.title: Nangartas Waterfall
attractions.description: A breathtaking waterfall viewable from a viewpoint, located on the Sawantwadi–Amboli road.

attractions.title: Mahadevgad Point
attractions.description: Offers panoramic views of the Konkan region and stunning sunset vistas.

marineLife.intro: Though Amboli is a hill station, its ecosystem supports rich terrestrial biodiversity.

items.title: Amboli Bush Frog
items.description: A rare amphibian species found only in this region, symbolizing its ecological importance.

items.title: Flora & Fauna
items.description: Dense forests host rare orchids, medicinal plants, and numerous reptile and insect species.

conclusion: Amboli’s biodiversity contributes to its recognition as an ecological hotspot.
It is part of the Western Ghats, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

howToReach.title: By Train
details: Nearest railway station: Sawantwadi Road (30 km).
Taxis and local jeeps are available from the station to Amboli.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Amboli is well-connected by road from Goa (70 km), Belgaum (68 km), and Pune (400 km).
Regular MSRTC and private buses operate from major cities.

howToReach.title: By Air
details: Nearest airport: Dabolim Airport, Goa (90 km).
Taxis are available from the airport directly to Amboli.

bookingTips.description: Carry rain gear during monsoon, as Amboli experiences heavy rainfall.
Keep your camera ready – every corner is photogenic, especially waterfalls.
Book homestays or eco-resorts for a more local and nature-centric experience.
